Content.Question:
Welcome to SuperMemo 18

SuperMemo will help you:

  • collect and organize knowledge
  • learn fast
  • forget about forgetting

Use Learn below to get a quick course on SuperMemo by SuperMemo.

If you see a page that you do not want to learn you can:

  1. Delete it, or
  2. Dismiss it (i.e. remove from the learning process without deleting)

To dismiss a page press Ctrl+D.

This will keep the page in your collection but you will not have it presented for review.

Content.Question:
Remember!

If you see a piece of information that you do not want to remember, or you are sure that you will remember anyway (i.e. without SuperMemo), press Ctrl+D

Press Ctrl+D now to never see this page again while making repetitions

Hint: You do not have to worry that you will forget the Ctrl+D shortcut because of pressing Ctrl+D now. You have already memorized a similar page (earlier in this course)

LearningData.RepHist: Topic #27: Try it now! Dismiss this page

Content.Question:
This is how SuperMemo works:
  1. Collect learning material: SuperMemo helps you create collections of facts that you would like to remember
  2. Test your memory: SuperMemo tests your knowledge of individual facts and collects information about your memory
  3. Make smart repetitions: By understanding your memory, SuperMemo finds the optimum timing for review of the learned material
  4. Save time: With minimum repetitions, you waste no time on material you know well

Press Enter to continue reading

LearningData.RepHist: Topic #3: How does SuperMemo work?<br>ElNo=3 Rep=2 Laps=0 Date=02.11.2021 Hour=17.421 Int=36 Grade=10 Priority=78.6207<br>ElNo=3 Rep=1 Laps=0 Date=27.09.2021 Hour=17.552 Int=89 Grade=10 Priority=68.9655

Content.Question:
To use SuperMemo, you only need to learn two keystrokes:

  • Ctrl+L - make repetitions of the learning material (Learn)
  • Alt+A - to add new questions and answers (Add new)

Optional reading at super-memory.com:

  • Learn
  • Add new

Content.Question:
You can now try to add your own questions and answers.

Press Alt+A now and type anything.

Hint: After you finish typing the question, you can use Esc to move to the answer

Remember!

  • You can return to learning by choosing the Learn button or pressing Ctrl+L or just Enter.
  • You can also return to the previously visited pages by pressing the button (Alt+Left arrow) at the top of this window.

Content.Question:
You can return to the previously visited pages by using the button at the top of this window.

You can also press Alt+Left arrow to obtain the same effect.

Conversely, you can move forward on the list of previously visited pages by pressing Alt+Right arrow (i.e. in the same way as you do it in Internet Explorer)

Hint: Try it now! Press Alt+Left arrow first and then follow it with Alt+Right arrow to return to this page.

Content.Question:
Remember! Repetitions are scheduled for you by SuperMemo!

You will be surprised to know that it is often better to avoid repetition in order to build long-term memory. You may be annoyed that SuperMemo forces you to go against your own intuition. However, this is how your memory works! Keep in mind that to speed up learning, SuperMemo uses a dose of randomness, which is often confusing for newcomers.

Trust SuperMemo and be patient!

Sometimes you will need to wait a week before SuperMemo first asks you a question in a given subject. Use this time to learn new material. This is the power of SuperMemo:

More time for new material = Faster learning

When do you make a repetition of a given piece of knowledge?
(click the correct answer and check the grade given by SuperMemo at the bottom of the screen)
Content.Answer: SuperMemo decides the right time (e.g. in a month)

LearningData.RepHist: Item #42: When does a repetition occur?<br>ElNo=42 Rep=1 Laps=1 Date=02.11.2021 Hour=15.968 Int=36 Grade=2 Priority=52.4138 Difficulty=1 expFI=85<br>ElNo=42 Rep=1 Laps=0 Date=27.09.2021 Hour=34.339 Int=0 Grade=3 Priority=48.9655 expFI=99

Content.Question:
If you remember to make all your repetitions every day, SuperMemo will make sure you remember 95% of the learned material.

You can increase this number at the cost of the speed of learning. You can also learn faster but remember less.
For more details see: Forgetting index at supermemo.guru

Rarely, your material may be so difficult that SuperMemo will not be able to guarantee 95% recall. To prevent this from happening, read: 20 rules of formulating knowledge

LearningData.RepHist: Topic #35: 95% retention<br>ElNo=35 Rep=2 Laps=0 Date=02.11.2021 Hour=17.42 Int=36 Grade=10 Priority=83.4483<br>ElNo=35 Rep=1 Laps=0 Date=27.09.2021 Hour=34.341 Int=89 Grade=10 Priority=68.9655

Content.Question:
Remember!

If you complete your repetitions every day (button Learn), SuperMemo will make sure you remember 95% of the learned material. Only a tiny fraction of your learning material will be presented for review daily. This fraction is compulsory if you want to ensure 95% retention.

Content.Question:
SuperMemo will often ask you to fill the missing part of a sentence. For example:

[...] is the key weapon against forgetting

Hint: Try to recall the key weapon against forgetting. What word should replace the three dots?
Content.Answer:
Repetition

Hint #1: Did you remember? If not, grade yourself Fail or less. Then press Enter.

HTML.Name: Hint #2: If a date shows up at the bottom of this window, it tells you when SuperMemo will next ask you the same question again! Usually the first review will happen in a few days

Content.Question:
To make sure you remember well, SuperMemo will test your memory. Each little test will include these steps:

  • SuperMemo will show you a question
  • You will answer the question (mentally or verbally)
  • You will click Show answer (or press Enter) to see the correct answer
  • You will compare your response with the answer displayed by SuperMemo
  • You will choose a grade reflecting how well you remember (e.g. Good if you remember well, Fail if you do not remember, etc.)
  • You will choose Next repetition (or Enter)

Let's test it on an example (press Enter)

LearningData.RepHist: Topic #23: Repetition cycle<br>ElNo=23 Rep=2 Laps=0 Date=02.11.2021 Hour=15.805 Int=36 Grade=10 Priority=78.6207<br>ElNo=23 Rep=1 Laps=0 Date=27.09.2021 Hour=32.48 Int=89 Grade=10 Priority=68.9655

Content.Question:
Which year was the United Nations established?

Hint: Look at the question above and try to answer it (mentally or verbally). Choose Show answer (or press Enter) to see the correct answer
Content.Answer:
1945

Hint: Compare your response with the correct answer: 1945. Choose a grade: e.g. Great (5) if you answered 1945, or Fail (2) if you answered 1935. Press Enter to continue (optional reading explains grades: Learning with SuperMemo)

LearningData.RepHist: Item #24: Exemplary repetition<br>ElNo=24 Rep=2 Laps=0 Date=02.11.2021 Hour=16.665 Int=36 Grade=5 Priority=53.1034 Difficulty=0.332 expFI=94<br>ElNo=24 Rep=1 Laps=0 Date=27.09.2021 Hour=32.481 Int=0 Grade=4 Priority=48.2759 expFI=99

Content.Question:
Repetition is the key weapon against forgetting

Everything you learn with SuperMemo will come back to you for review and repetition. Every day, you should review your scheduled portion of the learning material. Start with pressing Ctrl+L, or Enter, or choose Learn (if visible).

Press Enter to go from page to page. Sometimes, SuperMemo will ask you to grade yourself (e.g. Bright, Good, Pass, Fail, etc.). In such cases, click the grade that best reflects how well you remember. The pictures show grades as text or as icons.

Optional reading at supermemo.guru: General Principles of SuperMemo

Content.Question:
【单选题】统计三大职能是（）。

A.调查、分析、设计B.信息、咨询、监督C.调查、信息、咨询D.咨询、设计、分析
Content.Answer: 【答案】B【解析】统计的信息、咨询和监督三大职能，是相互作用、相互促进、相辅相成和密切联系的。

Content.Question: 统计监督，是根据统计调查和统计分析，从总体上反映国民经济和社会发展的运行状态，并按照客观规律的要求对其实行全面、系统的___、___、___，以促使经济和社会持续、协调、稳定地发展。
Content.Answer: 定量检查、监测和预警

Content.Question:
知识点二、普查★★★

如我国的人口普查、农业普查每（）开展一次，经济普查每（）开展一次。
Content.Answer: 10年  5年

Content.Question:
知识点一、统计的基本任务★

这里所说的统计，是指[...]人民政府、[...]以上人民政府统计机构和有关部门组织实施的[...]，主要包括各级人民政府组织实施的统计，国家统计局及其派出的各级调查队和县级以上地方各级人民政府统计机构组织实施的统计，国务院和县级以上地方各级人民政府各部门组织实施的统计各级;
Content.Answer:
县级;县级;
统计活动;

Content.Question: 在统计工作中，__和__分析是紧密衔接的两个环节。(统计工作的具体环节)
Content.Answer: 统计调查 统计分析

Content.Question: 统计的__三大职能，是相互作用、相互促进、相辅相成和密切联系的。
Content.Answer: 信息、咨询和监督。

Content.Question: 《中华人民共和国统计法》规定：统计的基本任务是对______ 情况进行统计调查、统计分析，提供统计资料和统计咨询意见，实行统计监督。
Content.Answer: 经济社会发展

Content.Question:
统计的3个基本任务（一）[...]

（二）提供统计资料和统计咨询意见

（三）实行统计监督进行统计调查、统计分析;
Content.Answer: 进行统计调查、统计分析（信息）

Content.Question:
【单选题】统计工作中，统计调查和（）是紧密衔接的两个环节。

A.统计咨询B.统计监督C.统计分析D.统计实施
Content.Answer: 【答案】C【解析】在统计工作中，统计调查和统计分析是紧密衔接的两个环节

Content.Question: 周期性普查主要有__。
Content.Answer: 人口普查、经济普查和农业普查

Content.Question: 到目前为止，我国分别于()()()()成功开展了四次全国经济普查。4，5，5
Content.Answer: 2004年、2008年、2013年和2018年

Content.Question:
知识点二、普查★★★

第四次全国经济普查中，遵循()与()同步推进的原则
Content.Answer: 数据处理 方案设计

Image.Name: 2018年国家统计局组织开展了第二次全国时间利用的随机抽样调查，共调查48580人。结果显示，受访居民在一天的活动中，有酬劳动平均用时4小时24分钟。其中，男性5小时15分钟，女性3小时35分钟；城镇居民3小时59分钟，农村居民5小时1分钟；工作日4小时50分钟，休息日3小时19分钟。受访居民有酬劳动的参与率为59.0%，其中城镇居民53 . (Component 4)
2018年国家统计局组织开展了第二次全国时间利用的随机抽样调查，共调查48580人。结果显示，受访居民在一天的活动中，有酬劳动平均用时4小时24分钟。其中，男性5小时15分钟，女性3小时35分钟；城镇居民3小时59分钟，农村居民5小时1分钟；工作日4小时50分钟，休息日3小时19分钟。受访居民有酬劳动的参与率为59.0%，其中城镇居民53 . (Component 4)S

Content.Question:
统计的3个基本任务

（一）进行统计调查、统计分析

（二）[...]

（三）实行统计监督

SuperMemoElement.Title: 统计学基础知识_第3章_参数估计

Content.Question:
Congratulations! That's all! You have just learned the basics of SuperMemo!

Now you will need to trust the program for some time before you can see the effects of your work. Your trust will grow if you know how SuperMemo works (see: Principles of SuperMemo).

Use the Learn button (Ctrl+L) daily to make sure you do not forget what you have learned.
Use Add new (Alt+A) to add new questions and answers.

Do not forget to back-up your learning material from time to time. Use File : Copy collection (Ctrl+Shift+C) from the main menu to copy your material to some location on your hard disk, flash drive, or an external hard disk. If you cannot see this option, you need to switch SuperMemo to a higher level that exposes some extra functionality in the program. E.g. to switch SuperMemo from the Beginner level to the next Basic level (in which the Copy collection becomes visible), select File : Level : Beginner.

Remember that you have two B-choices: Back up or Be sorry!

Please take a minute to read: How to back up your learning material in SuperMemo.

To learn more advanced options of SuperMemo, visit 25 Steps to SuperMemo Mastery.

LearningData.RepHist: Topic #20: Backup<br>ElNo=20 Rep=1 Laps=0 Date=27.09.2021 Hour=34.344 Int=89 Grade=10 Priority=68.9655

Content.Question:
Do not forget to back-up your learning material from time to time.

Use File : Copy collection (Ctrl+Shift+C) to copy your learning material to some location on your hard disk. Any time you can be hit by a virus, a software crash, or a hardware failure!

Remember! Back up or Be sorry

Read more about back-ups at super-memory.com.

Content.Question:
Try to import an article now!

For example:

  1. Open any article in your web browser (for example, right click over this link www.super-memory.com/help/read.htm and choose Open in new window)
  2. Select any portion of text with the mouse (in the browser)
  3. Press Ctrl+C (in the browser)
  4. Return to SuperMemo (e.g. with Alt+Tab)
  5. Press Ctrl+N (in SuperMemo)

Hint #1: After you have imported an article, you can always return to this page by using the button (Alt+Left arrow).

Hint #2: You can also import articles directly from Wikipedia. If Internet Explorer is your default browser*:
  1. press Ctrl+Shift+W,
  2. type SuperMemo, and
  3. press Enter to import an article about SuperMemo from Wikipedia.

* If you use another browser, you will need to first open a Wikipedia article in Internet Explorer, and only then press Ctrl+Shift+W.

LearningData.RepHist: Topic #56: Try Ctrl+N<br>ElNo=56 Rep=2 Laps=0 Date=02.11.2021 Hour=17.323 Int=36 Grade=10 Priority=91.7241<br>ElNo=56 Rep=1 Laps=0 Date=27.09.2021 Hour=34.348 Int=89 Grade=10 Priority=70.3448

Content.Question:
Incremental reading: Importing articles

The first step in incremental learning is to import an article to read and learn. Usually you will import an article directly from the Internet.

There are 2 basic ways of importing an article:

  1. One article - copy the selected text in your web browser to the clipboard, and use (Ctrl+N) in SuperMemo
  2. Many articles - open many articles in Internet Explorer, and use Edit : Import web pages : All (Ctrl+Shift+A) in SuperMemo. You will be able to import the selected articles.

    Hint: If you cannot see Edit : Import web pages : All in the main menu, you need to switch SuperMemo to File : Level : Middle or higher level for the option to become available.

LearningData.RepHist: Topic #43: Importing articles<br>ElNo=43 Rep=2 Laps=0 Date=02.11.2021 Hour=17.424 Int=36 Grade=10 Priority=82.069<br>ElNo=43 Rep=1 Laps=0 Date=27.09.2021 Hour=34.346 Int=89 Grade=10 Priority=69.6552

Content.Question:
Even though you have already learned the basics of SuperMemo, you should know that the program provides you with a yet more powerful learning weapon: Incremental reading.

Incremental reading is more complex than basic SuperMemo, and may require more training. But it will help you read thousands of articles imported from the Internet. It will also help you quickly convert those articles into rock-solid knowledge.

Press Enter for some hints.

You can read more about incremental reading at supermemo.org

Content.Question:
To convert a sentence into a cloze:

  1. Select a meaningful keyword in the sentence (e.g. by double-clicking it with the mouse), and
  2. use (Alt+Z) at the bottom of this window

Hint: To see the newly created cloze question, choose the button (Alt+Left arrow)

LearningData.RepHist: Topic #65: Cloze tools<br>ElNo=65 Rep=2 Laps=0 Date=02.11.2021 Hour=17.422 Int=36 Grade=10 Priority=85.5172<br>ElNo=65 Rep=1 Laps=0 Date=27.09.2021 Hour=34.351 Int=89 Grade=10 Priority=69.6552

Content.Question:
You can convert fragments of articles to questions and answers. You will do it using the tool called Cloze. A cloze is a sentence with a word missing and replaced with three dots. Such a sentence can be understood as a question. Your job is to recall the missing part of the sentence.

For example:

Sentence:

The theory of relativity was proposed by Einstein.

Cloze:

Question: The theory of relativity was proposed by [...]
Answer: Einstein

LearningData.RepHist: Topic #63: Converting extracts to questions and answers<br>ElNo=63 Rep=2 Laps=0 Date=02.11.2021 Hour=17.421 Int=36 Grade=10 Priority=89.6552<br>ElNo=63 Rep=1 Laps=0 Date=27.09.2021 Hour=34.35 Int=89 Grade=10 Priority=69.6552

Content.Question:
You can import many articles from Internet Explorer if you select Edit : Import web pages: All from the main menu* (alternatively, press Ctrl+Shift+A).

If you press Ctrl+Shift+W instead of Ctrl+Shift+A you will see only Wikipedia articles (instead of all articles).
Similarly, if you press Ctrl+Shift+Y, you will only see YouTube videos for import.

* If you cannot see Edit : Import web pages : All, select File : Level : Middle or higher.

Content.Question:
During reading, you will extract the most important parts of your article for learning. This is to make sure you do not forget the most important parts of the article.

Extracting a selection will do the following:

  • create a new element/page containing the extracted fragment
  • introduce this new page into the learning process (i.e. repetitions)
  • mark the extracted fragment in the original article as "extracted"

To extract an important fragment of your article:

  1. select the fragment, and
  2. use (Alt+X) at the bottom of this window

Content.Question:
Try to make an extract now!

For example:

  1. Select the italic text below, and
  2. press Alt+X
EXTRACT EXAMPLE:
In the late 1990s the Security Council authorized peacekeeping operations to set up a transitional administration in Kosovo (part of the Federal Republic of Yugoslavia), to restore peace in East Timor and administer the territory during its transition to independence, and to help implement a peace treaty in Sierra Leone

Hint: Use the button (Alt+Left arrow) to see the result of your action.

Content.Question:
To learn more about SuperMemo, see:

  • 25 Steps to SuperMemo Mastery
  • Incremental learning
  • SuperMemoPedia
  • SuperMemo Guru

If you think SuperMemo is hard-to-learn, please be patient! Do not start too fast. Learning must always be a pleasure!
Your investment in studying SuperMemo will be generously returned.
Research indicates that user satisfaction increases with each month of practice!

Good luck!
